page.title: 17Aston Tirrold and Upthorpe
page.content: These villages are relatively isolated and rely largely on the churches for recreational activities. The parish magazine which covers this area is called Â£The Link' and is published every month. With few other facilities, this is an important means of keeping in touch with local affairs. Religion has long roots in the Astons. There are three stone crosses in the area. Lower Cross is at the junction of Main Road and Blewbury Road, Coscte and Upper Cross are near the Church but only the Upper Cross remains complete asthe others were smashed by the Puritans.
